title.narrative: UPDATED EVIDENCE, POLICIES AND STRATEGIES ON Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) AND HIV

description.narrative: Evidence is generated and policies and strategies on Maternal, Neonatal, and Child Health (MNCH) and HIV are updated to be in line with global recommendations., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Innovation, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Young children, adolescents and women use improved and equitable high-impact maternal, newborn and child health (MNCH) and HIV services.

sector.narrative: Coordination support, Civil society support, Guideline development, Capacity development, M/E systems and Technical Support for HIV prevention, treatment and care
Digital Health and Health Information Systems
Facility based maternal and newborn care (including emergency obstetric and newborn care, quality improvement)

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Evidence is generated and policies and strategies on MNCH and HIV are updated to be in line with global recommendations.

description.narrative: Rwanda incorporated new guidance related to COVID-19-specific measures for MNCAH and HIV by issuing guidance notes and standard operating procedures (SOPs) for health workers. The existing policies and strategies continue to support implementation of MNCAH and HIV services. With support from UNICEF, community health policy, emergency-obstetric protocols, emergency obstetric care guidelines and training materials, and newborn and obstetric norms and standards were developed. With UNICEF’s support the development of an investment case for community health was completed; the development of a community health programme strategic plan is ongoing to be completed in the first quarter of 2022. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:30/12/2021

title.narrative: Electronic patient management system is functional and generates real-time evidence in select hospitals. Indicator rating: 0 no system exists; 1 system piloted; 2 smallscale; 3 scaled up nationally(59434), Number

Operational Plans to improve access and utilization of adolescent HIV intervention in 4 districts and urban areas with high burden of HIV are developed and implemented. Indicator rating: 0 no operational plans; 1 developed; 2 smallscale innovative , Number
National HIV policy and strategies are updated with focus on reducing new HIV infections among young children and adolescents(59432), Text
National MNCH policy and strategies are updated with focus on highimpact interventions to reduce child mortality(61479), Text
